result.execSummary:
The defendant Claudine S. Maltais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Claudine S. Maltais in court with attorney Maura O'Connell Melka.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee files an amended information with the court; replacing the original charge.  Atty Hendee states that parties are not requesting a PSI.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to that amended charge.  Atty Melka agrees and enters a No Contest plea to that amended charge.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.  State is not requesting a PSI.
Atty Melka makes sentencing arguments and states that the defendant is not requesting a PSI.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge (if not done so already)
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Rec'd fax from Atty Melka requesting that the JT for the 15th be taken off and set Status 30 days out.
- set for Return / Plea per the Judge
Return date on February 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Claudine S. Maltais in court with attorney Maura O'Connell Melka.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Claudine S Maltais in court with attorney Maura O'Connell Melka.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant regarding the Prelim.  Atty Melka is prepared to waive the Prelim.  Atty Hendee requests an arraignment be set to a different date.
Atty Melka states that the defendant will waive the Prelim.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and waives the Prelim.  
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendant's waiver of the Preliminary Hearing.
   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee will file the information at a later date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment.
bond continued.
  Arraignment scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Return date on July 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Claudine S Maltais in court with attorney Maura O Melka.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Melka; the defendant will be waiving the time limits for the Prelim.
Atty Melka agrees with the waiver of the time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.

Atty Melka asks for a Return.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.
PETITION FOR LEAVE FOR TIME TO FILE ADDITIONAL MOTIONS
Preliminary hearing on June 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

with conditions:
*No contact with Crystal or Corey Jerome

Defendant Claudine S Maltais in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Atty Hendee requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions:
No contact with Crystal Jerome or Corey Jerome.  Atty Gumz states that he will be appointing this case out to private bar.  Atty Gumz asks the court to consider a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Crystal or Corey Jerome.

Atty Gumz requests a Prelim but does not waive time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Preliminary Hearing; time limits were not waived.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
